Class BESTform

  • java.lang.Object
    • BESTform
  • public class BESTform
extends java.lang.Object
    BEST (Borderline Evaluation of Severity over Time) form data BEST is copyrighted 1997 by Bruce Pfohl, M.D. and Nancee Blum, M.S.W. University of Iowa, Dept of Psychiatry, 200 Hawkins Dr, Iowa City, IA 52242 from STEPPS (Systems Training for Emotional Predictability and Problem Solving) (c) Copyright 2002, 2008, N.S. Blum, N.E. Bartels, D. St. John, B. Pfohl, All rights reserved. STEPPS^TM is the Trademark of N.S. Blum, N.E. Bartels, D. St. John, B. Pfohl, All rights reserved. requires src/BESTquestions.txt and uses data file src/BESTdata.txt, which appends if it exists and creates if it does not.
    Author:
    jefferydecker@gmail.com jmdecker1@dmacc.edu

    • Method Detail

      • getDate

        public java.util.Date getDate()
        Date of evaluation.
        Returns:
        the date

      • setDate

        public void setDate​(java.util.Date date)
        Date of the evaluation. In this version it is hard-coded to the current date, but in future version the user will be able to enter a date so that past evaluations (performed on paper form) can be input.
        Parameters:
        date - the date to set

      • getTimePeriod

        public int getTimePeriod()
        The time period in number of days that is being evaluated. Hard-coded to seven in this version.
        Returns:
        the timePeriod

      • setTimePeriod

        public void setTimePeriod​(int timePeriod)
        The time period that is being evaluated in number of days, typically 7 or 30 days can be something else. For now it's set to 7 and the user is not given the option to change it. In a future version, I intend to read in the date of the previous evaluation and set it by default to the number of days since then.
        Parameters:
        timePeriod - the timePeriod to set

      • getRating

        public int getRating​(int index)
        get the specified user response
        Parameters:
        index - - the question/statement number (minus 1)
        Returns:
        a rating

      • getRatings

        public int[] getRatings()
        get entire array of user responses
        Returns:
        rating array

      • getCategorySum

        public int[] getCategorySum()
        Returns:
        the categorySum array

      • getOverallScore

        public int getOverallScore()
        Returns:
        the overallScore

      • setRating

        void setRating​(int index,
               int value)
        Given the question number (minus 1) set its result to value provided.
        Parameters:
        index - - the question / statement number (minus 1)
        value - rating value selected by user

      • processForm

        void processForm()
        Process the form once the user has selected all ratings. Accumulate category sums and and calculate overallScore.

      • loadStmnts

        void loadStmnts()
         throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Load Statements into priority queue
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - on missing src/BESTquestions.txt

      • saveForm

        boolean saveForm()
        Save form data to text file src/BESTdata.txt. Note: currently saving score and section sums: considering not saving these.
        Returns:
        true if record is successfully written to (TODO file / database)

      • readForm

        boolean readForm()
        Returns:
        true if form data is successfully read from (TODO file / database)
